importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's update indicates the latest information available about the Netflix series announcement, signaling a timely cultural and media development.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series spans from the 1930s to the early 1950s, focusing on the formative years of the Kennedy family, including the rise of Joe Kennedy Sr. and the early development of Jack Kennedy.

keyTakeAways: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall's book 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956.'
The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and follows the family's rise and struggles from the 1930s onward.
The show explores both the triumphs and tragedies of the Kennedy family, including the legacy of assassination and the 'Kennedy curse' that has haunted the dynasty.
The narrative centers on Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, with particular focus on Jack Kennedy's struggle to escape the shadow of his older brother, Robert F. Kennedy.
The series is not to be confused with Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr.
The showrunner, Sam Shaw, describes the Kennedys' story as a blend of American mythology and a nuanced exploration of personal and historical struggles.
The series will consist of eight episodes and has not yet been released, though it is set to air soon on Netflix.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A global streaming platform that has announced a new television series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Netflix is a major player in global media, and the announcement of a new Kennedy series reflects its strategy to produce historically grounded, high-profile dramas that appeal to a broad audience.

namedEntities.name: Michael Fassbender
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A British actor known for his roles in films and television.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Fassbender's casting as Joe Kennedy Sr. brings significant star power and credibility to the series, elevating its cultural and entertainment appeal.

namedEntities.name: Kennedy family
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Kennedy family is a symbol of American political power and tragedy, making it a compelling subject for a modern dramatization that blends history and myth.

namedEntities.name: Joe Kennedy, Sr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The patriarch of the Kennedy family and father of John F. Kennedy.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His role as the central character in the series reflects the foundational importance of the family's early years in shaping American political culture.

namedEntities.name: Jack Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The second son of Joe and Rose Kennedy, who became the 35th U.S. president.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Jack Kennedy’s struggle to escape his brother’s shadow is a central theme of the series, highlighting personal and familial dynamics within the dynasty.

namedEntities.name: Robert F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The older brother of Jack Kennedy, who was a senator and presidential hopeful.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His role as a key sibling figure underscores the family's internal conflicts and political ambitions, contributing to the narrative depth of the series.

namedEntities.name: Fredrik Logevall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A historian and author of the book 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956.'
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His book serves as the source material for the series, providing historical authenticity and insight into the Kennedy family’s formative years.

namedEntities.name: Sam Shaw
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: As the showrunner, Sam Shaw is responsible for shaping the narrative and thematic direction of the series, emphasizing its historical and cultural depth.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A television producer known for creating dramas like 'American Horror Story.'
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ryan Murphy is noted for producing a separate 'American Love Story' focusing on JFK Jr., which helps clarify that the new Netflix series is distinct from that project.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The son of John F. Kennedy who died in a 1999 plane crash.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His tragic death is cited as part of the Kennedy family's curse, reinforcing the emotional and mythological weight of the family’s legacy.

namedEntities.name: JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A book by Fredrik Logevall that is the basis for the series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This book provides the historical framework and narrative foundation for the series, lending credibility and depth to the dramatization.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography of the Kennedy family, set to star Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr. The series spans from the 1930s to the 1950s, exploring the family’s rise, struggles, and tragedies, including the personal and political pressures faced by Jack Kennedy and his siblings. The showrunner, Sam Shaw, describes the Kennedys as a blend of American mythology and human struggle, offering a nuanced look behind the political legend. The series will consist of eight episodes and is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr. While the show has not yet been released, its announcement marks a significant cultural moment in modern media.
title: Netflix announces new Kennedy family series starring Michael Fassbender
